title: Fragment of an architrave dedicated to Marcus Aurelius Antoninus
support: Part of an architrave, re-used as a step in the Church of S.Peter 'de Balneariis'; no further details recorded.

handNote.lettering: No details of the form of the text preserved, although Torremuzza describes as grand letters in a single line

date._: The nomenclature in this precise form only apparently attested for Caracalla, but in principle several of those from Marcus Aurelius to Elagabalus are possible

provenanceFound._: First recorded in Fazello 1558, in use as a step in the Church of S. Peter 'de Balneariis'; seen there too, apparently, by Gualtherus, and Torremuzza; now seemingly lost.
